posts.raw_content:
I don't care what a piece of paper says. I want the million Somalis living in this country to no longer be here. We are fighting a war for this country. It isn't 1985 anymore. We don't have time to engage in elections while the other side cheats. 

I'm glad Matt Walsh is starting to break from his Shapiro programming. He's 100% correct. We need to be willing to work with anyone who is anti left to win. Democrats already call even spineless Republicans fascists so we may as well use authoritarianism to snuff out all leftism in this country. I want a future where teachers, actors and DAs are terrified of being viewed as leftwing  - you know, what we have had to endure for generations. 

We do not need to engage in politics within the confines of what cowardly liberals and moderates think is appropriate. I want to see leftism ripped from every institution. 

If you control the military and police, you control the country. 70% of military and 80% of law enforcement voted for Trump. Those numbers are just close enough that we can seriously just start ignoring judges and DAs.

posts.raw_content:
I’ve obviously attended weddings, funerals and some family events like confirmations but I mean to say went this Sunday for the sole purpose of opening my ears and my heart to Christianity. After Charlie was murdered my brother and I attended the memorial service in Phoenix something over these last several weeks has dislodged and unmoored me from my ambivalence. 

I’m really not even certain how to navigate these feelings or what to make of them. I’ve spent my life sarcastically describing myself as a devout agnostic and while I generally tried to respect others for holding spiritual beliefs I kind of thought I was too intelligent to fall for it. 

Now I’m in a weird place. I’m trying to overcome my long held distrust of people who believe and open up to the possibility. I’m not a bad person but I’m not an especially good person either. I have some deep regrets and some shameful tendencies that are like an anchor I can’t seem to break from. 

If you get a moment would you maybe say a little prayer for me? 

Love you guys!
posts.author: awsure
posts.title: I went to church for the first time in 45 years this past Sunday
posts.content:
I’ve obviously attended weddings, funerals and some family events like confirmations but I mean to say went this Sunday for the sole purpose of opening my ears and my heart to Christianity. After Charlie was murdered my brother and I attended the memorial service in Phoenix something over these last several weeks has dislodged and unmoored me from my ambivalence.

I’m really not even certain how to navigate these feelings or what to make of them. I’ve spent my life sarcastically describing myself as a devout agnostic and while I generally tried to respect others for holding spiritual beliefs I kind of thought I was too intelligent to fall for it.

Now I’m in a weird place. I’m trying to overcome my long held distrust of people who believe and open up to the possibility. I’m not a bad person but I’m not an especially good person either. I have some deep regrets and some shameful tendencies that are like an anchor I can’t seem to break from.

If you get a moment would you maybe say a little prayer for me?

Love you guys!
